questionTitle: <u><font color='red'>Cotton</font></u> used to <u><font color='red'>rank</font></u> first <u><font color='red'>between</font></u> Alabama's crops, but it <u><font color='red'>represents only</font></u> a fraction of the agricultural production now.

Salmon <u><font color='red'>lay</font></u> their eggs and die in fresh water, <u><font color='red'>although</font></u> they live in salt water <u><font color='red'>when</font></u> most of their <u><font color='red'>adult lives</font></u>.
To <u><font color='red'>building</font></u> their <u><font color='red'>nests</font></u>, tailorbirds use <u><font color='red'>their</font></u> bills <u><font color='red'>as</font></u> needles.
